results.title: Gallery of the great. No. 1. Churchill
results.brief_description: Profile of Winston Spencer Churchill, from his days in the Spanish forces in Cuba; through to war correspondent; Home Secretary; Mayor during the 1914-18 war; Chancellor of the Ex-Checker; and finally a victorious Prime Minister at the end of WWII. Contains archival footage.

results.title: Gallant Bess
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Harry Rapf and Andrew Marton
results.brief_description: A story of love and loyalty between a young man and his horse until the outbreak of WWII when Tex (Marshall Thompson) joins the Seabees and has to leave his beautiful mare Bess behind. Tragedy strikes when Bess dies giving birth but Tex, stationed on a small Pacific Island, finds new hope and friendship when he becomes acquainted with another horse, one that turns out to be a good-luck charm. Cast includes George Tobias, Clem Bevans, Donald Curtis.

results.title: Galileo: the challenge of reason
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Dennis Azzarella
results.brief_description: Examines the life of Galileo, humanist and founder of modern experimental science, who, because of his unorthodox belief, was brought to trial before the Inquisition in 1632. It establishes a contemporary theme in the confrontation between an individual and the Establishment.

results.title: Galaxy quest
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Mark Johnson, Charles Newirth and Dean Parisot
results.brief_description: A fast-paced comedy which affectionately parodies television science fiction series’ such as Star Trek, and the devoted fandom which most often accompanies it. For four years, the intrepid crew of the classic television sci-fi series, Galaxy Quest, zoomed around the galaxy in their ship, the NSEA Protector, embarking on perilous missions, and battling hostile life forms. Twenty years later, at the Eighteenth Galaxy Quest convention, the show’s original stars are still squeezing into their costumes, and resignedly preparing for yet another meet and greet with their die-hard fans. Arriving late, actor Jason Nesmith (Tim Allen), or “Commander Peter Quincy Taggart” to his fan base, manages to earn the disapproval of his castmates after they accuse him of taking paid work without them. Upset at being rejected, irritated by the undying attention of his fans, and fed up with his lack of career prospects, Nesmith storms out of the conference to go on a drinking binge. The next day, the group of pale, black-clad “aliens” who sought him out at the convention arrive at his hilltop condominium, claiming to require his help. Hung over, and believing it to be a paying acting job, Nesmith agrees to go with them. However, only when he is teleported to their ship, and asked to negotiate with a ruthless alien adversary does he grasp the true nature of the situation. Persuading the rest of the NSEA Protector’s crew to join him in this completely unscripted adventure, Nesmith and the others embark on what is to be the greatest acting role of their lives. Includes Alan Rickman as frustrated thespian Alexander Dane/Dr. Lazarus, Sigourney Weaver as requisite blonde eye candy, Gwen DeMarco/Lt. Tawny Madison, Tony Shalhoub as dense engineer Fred Kwan/Tech. Sgt. Chen, Darryl Mitchell as former child prodigy Tommy Webber/Laredo, and Sam Rockwell as extra-turned-permanent crew mate Guy Fleegman/Security Chief ‘Roc’ Ingersol.

results.title: Galaxy
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: An experimental film using firework images, sometimes superimposed and sometimes in very soft focus. The mystery of outer space is evoked, its blackness broken by shooting stars and meteor trails, gaseous clouds and solar configurations. The sound track has reversed and slowed down triangle and cymbals added to an accelerated piano and xylophone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill

results.title: Galapagos: my special land
results.brief_description: A look at the unique wildlife of the Galapagos Islands and the potential conflict between farming and tourism. Raises issues surrounding conservation, the development of species and natural selection.

results.title: Gala presentation and crowning of Miss Australia 1970
results.brief_description: A record of the Miss Australia Charity Quest of 1970 held in Adelaide. The state finalists are presented and interviewed before the crowning of Rhonda Ifland from NSW assisted by Miss Australia 1969, Susan McCellard. Hosted by Maggie Tabberer and Geoff McComas. Guests include: South Australian premier Steel Hall; and Bernard Dowd representing Hickory, the event sponsors. Hickory commercials are interspersed throughout the film.

results.title: Gala
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Canada Council, John Smith and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: For the first time in Canadian dance history, eight of the country’s leading dance companies gathered to perform on a single stage. The time, May 1981. The place, the National Arts Centre in Ottawa. The event, billed as the Canadian Dance Spectacular, offered a rich program of classical and jazz ballet, modern dance, gymnastics, pantomime and theatre. As well as recording this outstanding performance, Gala went backstage to capture the pre-performance jitters and post-performance elation. A film that showcases Canada’s cultural heritage. Film without words.
